meanings.definition: To place (items) back in their proper location or order.
meanings.sent1: After playing with his toys, Timmy started reracking them on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The librarian asked everyone to rerack the books after they were done reading.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept reracking the shoes in different places around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a messy room that needed reracking to find clarity.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were scattered, waiting to be reracked into a complete picture.

meanings.definition: The act of rearranging or organizing items back into their original position.
meanings.sent1: The reracking of the dishes in the cupboard made the kitchen look tidy.
meanings.sent2: During the game, the players took turns doing the reracking of the cards.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about the chaos caused by reracking at a grocery store.
meanings.sent4: In her dream, she saw the reracking of the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The reracking of the fallen dominoes created a satisfying pattern on the table.
